subject: Web3
title: NFTs and Intellectual Property
description: A quick, practical guide to NFTs and Intellectual Property.

hook.text: Buying an NFT usually doesn't give you the copyright. You own a token, not the intellectual property.

buildup.text: Bored Ape Yacht Club was an exception ‚Äî owners got commercial rights to their ape's image.

discovery.text: Ape owners made merchandise, restaurants, and music videos using their NFT artwork. A new licensing model emerged.

twist.text: Most projects don't grant these rights. Buyers assume they own the art when they legally don't.

climax.text: NFTs need clearer IP standards. Without them, ownership remains a gray area that confuses everyone.

punchline.text: You might own the NFT but not the art. Read the fine print.

quiz.question: Does buying an NFT typically give you the copyright?
options: Usually not ‚Äî you own the token, not the intellectual property
